properties.SiteSafety: Heavy Equipment; Water Hazard (PFD Required); Slips, Trips, Falls; Heavy Vegetation; Unstable Trees;  Area May Flood.
properties.FieldDescr: SW corner of Samish Water District settling ponds. May have to cut fence to access site. Use waders to access opposite bank, plywood for stability in mud. Use caution if anchoring to trees (shallow roots).

properties.Resources: Fish Hatchery, Fish Ladder(s), Salmonids, T/E Species, Water Intakes

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls.  Access point is on highway with narrow shoulder and heavy vegetation.  Use caution navigating in low water.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Launch at primitive boat ramp on canal right. Coordinate with Cascade Water Alliance contractor, Veolia Water at 253-590-3035, for access.

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Cascade Water Flume

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil coming downstream on the Cowlitz River to prevent it from entering the Columbia River
properties.Implementa: From BL-CWLZR-1.6, Crew 2 launch workboat to BNSF rail yard. Crew 1 stage 1000ft. boom in BNSF yard and attach line to end of boom.  Crew 1 pass line to Crew 2, and Crew 2 use line to pull boom across to center highway bridge piling. Anchor boom to pilin
properties.SiteSafety: Active railroad track. Slips, trips, and falls. Rail yard with heavy equipment traffic and overhead cranes.
properties.FieldDescr: Expect trains on the track at any time/from either direction. Do not allow people/equipment within 25’ of tracks. Site is BNSF rail yard at the confluence of the Cowlitz, Columbia, and Coweeman Rivers.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at BNSF Rail Yard. Contact Longview Yard Master for access.
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources

properties.Geographic: 148th Ave Bridge Crossing Cascade Water Tailrace
properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Cascade Water Tailrace
properties.Implementa: Secure 100 ft of boom to the upstream end of the bridge on river right, at/near Point A (47.23837, -122.231717), using shoreside anchor systems, or existing features. Then walk boom across bridge and anchor to the edge of the bridge on river left, at/nea
properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Heavy Vegetation
properties.FieldDescr: Tailrace has low flow but heavy blackberry bushes on all sides.  Park on either side and deploy boom from bridge, anchoring to bridge.
properties.StagingDes: Stage beside bridge, vac truck will be able to access river from either side
properties.Resources: Lake Habitat, Raptors, Sensitive Nesting Species, T/E Species, Waterfowl and Salmonid Concentrations and Habitat, Wetland Habitat

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil at boat launch to prevent oil from travelling upstream on Deep River
properties.Implementa: From WDFW boat ramp onsite, Crew 2 launch workboat towing line attached to boom on shore. Crew 1 remain onshore at boat launch and feed boom across to Crew 2.  Crew 1 anchor at AP-1 on boat launch dock.  Crew 2 anchor boom to AP-3 in river center to crea
properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls.  Possible traffic on Oneida Rd. Tidal mud and heavy vegetation on river left.
properties.FieldDescr: Site is a WDFW-managed boat launch and parking area with restroom and docks. River widens and slows in this location. Discover Pass Required.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at WDFW boat launch on Oneida Rd.
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources, Waterfowl Use Area, Wetland Habitat

properties.Geographic: Deer Creek at Judy Way (KM DE-0.9)
properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Deer Creek
properties.Implementa: Deploy one length of hard boom across creek on upstream/east side of wood bridge on Judy Way. Deploy multiple lengths of sorbent boom on upstream side of hard boom and on downstream/west side of bridge. Use shoreside anchoring systems or existing feature
properties.SiteSafety: DO NOT DRIVE VAC TRUCK OVER BRIDGE (NOT WEIGHT-RATED); Water Hazard (PFD Required); Slips, Trips, Falls; Heavy Vegetation.
properties.FieldDescr: DO NOT DRIVE VAC TRUCK OVER WOODEN BRIDGE. Not weight rated. Site is next to small private driveway and new wood bridge over creek crossing. Downstream of bridge has small waterfall and concrete anti-erosion chute.
properties.StagingDes: Stage onsite, at private road north of creek. Do not cross bridge with vac truck.
properties.Resources: Salmon Bearing Stream, Shorebirds, T/E Species, Waterfowl, Wetlands

properties.Geographic: Deer Creek at Aldrich Rd (KM DE-2.4)
properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Deer Creek
properties.Implementa: Deploy one length of hard boom across creek, downstream of Aldrich Road culvert. Deploy multiple lengths of sorbent across creek, upstream of hard boom. Deploy additional sorbent upstream of roadway. If time allows, use plywood and plastic to create culv
properties.SiteSafety: Water Hazard (PFD Required); Traffic Hazard; Heavy Vegetation; Slips, Trips, Falls.
properties.FieldDescr: Follow WSDOT work zone traffic control guidelines when working on or near roadway. No shoulder at road but private driveway along NW of creek. 4 ft. culvert.
properties.StagingDes: Stage onsite, on driveway adjacent to site. Lane closure may be required.
properties.Resources: Salmon Bearing Stream, Shorebirds, T/E Species, Waterfowl, Wetlands

properties.Geographic: Deer Creek above Guide Meridian (KM DE-4.2)

properties.SiteSafety: KEEP VEHICLES OFF DIRT TRAIL; Water Hazard (PFD Required); Slips, Trips, Falls; Heavy Vegetation
properties.FieldDescr: Enter driveway at carpet cleaners and leave vehicles up top. Walk down dirt path on N side of driveway to access creek at bottom of ravine. Use wood pedestrian bridge to walk 100 ft section of boom across Deer Creek.
properties.StagingDes: Stage onsite, in driveway (Green Carpet Cleaners); downhill path leads to site.
properties.Resources: Salmon (Coho, Chinook and Chum), Shorebirds, T/E Species, Waterfowl, Wetlands

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls.  Snags and submerged debris present at confluence. Fishermen and boater traffic in area.

properties.SiteSafety: Water Hazard (PFD Required); Rusty Metal Walkway; Eroding Banks; Slips, Trips, Falls; Heavy Vegetation.

properties.Implementa: Disengage floats on tide gate arms to close gates. Secure 200 ft section of boom upstream of Pioneer Highway on left bank, near A. Extend boom across slough using a line, and secure to creek right underneath bridge, at/near B. Collect using vac truck or

properties.FieldDescr: At public boat launch with long side inlet, in rough water may want to use launch inlet for collection. Tidal slough will reverse flow on incoming tide.

properties.Implementa: Anchor boom along creek bank near 45.571112,-122.315856, and on the opposite side of Gibbons Creek. Use additional anchor systems as needed  to keep boom secure in river. Use existing structures, anchor posts, or trees to secure boom to creek bank. Colle

properties.FieldDescr: Call BNSF. Call USACE. Expect trains on the track at any time/from either direction. Do not allow people/equipment within 25’ of tracks. East side of bridge will allow access into Steigerwald Lake National Wildlife Refuge, heading towards river.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls. Beware of log boom and other submerged hazards. Traffic may be present on Altoona-Pillar Rock Rd.  Use WSDOT guidelines for workzone traffic control.

properties.FieldDescr: Popular public golf course with busy golf cart trails.
properties.StagingDes: Parking and facilities at golf course. Use paved trails to move equipment/vac trucks.

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Green/Duwamish.

properties.FieldDescr: High waters can reach bridge bottom. Bridge height 7' from trail.
properties.StagingDes: Trail access from Bicentennial Park. Facilities and small parking area.

properties.SiteSafety: Slippery mud buildup at rivers edge near 4' drop to water. Trips and falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank. In-water woody debris.
properties.FieldDescr: Path is paved but narrow clearance, use ATV. Heavy vegetation on banks. Levee setback planned in area, adjust location as appropriate.
properties.StagingDes: Public flush restrooms and parking onsite. Hand-launch ramp at Van Doren's Landing 1.6 mi upstream.

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Green/Duwamish.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank.
properties.FieldDescr: Can use hand-launch boat instead of line gun if water is high enough, watch for woody debris in channel.
properties.StagingDes: Small parking lot 500 ft S of bridge. Hand-launch boat ramp at Van Doren's Landing 0.7 mi downstream.

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect and recover product from Green River at northern end of Riverbend Golf Course
properties.Implementa: Using hand-launch workboat, secure end of 300ft length of line around tree on river left near A (47.3852, -122.2653). Then extend line NE ~290ft securing it to bank on river right near B (47.3855, -122.2641). Deploy boom using power winch on river right.
properties.SiteSafety: Low overhead powerlines. Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank. In-river woody debris.
properties.FieldDescr: Do not deploy in low water. Western bank thick vegetation/blackberries. In-river woody debris will prevent boat use in low water.
properties.StagingDes: Boat launch 1.8 mi downstream at Van Dorens. Stage boom onsite river right or use golf course.
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources, Habitat Restoration Site/Project, Salmon Habitat, Waterfowl, Wetlands

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil moving downstream on Green/Duwamish.

properties.SiteSafety: Traffic - USE EXTREME CAUTION ON BRIDGE. Slips, trips, falls. Blackberry brambles on bank. Debris and sandbars in water channel.

properties.StagingDes: Dykstra public park has paved trails to bridge, cut bollards to access. N section of park has small paved area.
properties.Resources: City Park, Downstream Resources, Habitat Restoration Site/Project, Pump Station, Salmonids

properties.SiteSafety: Road traffic. Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank.
properties.FieldDescr: North bank trail access from Pike St NE at Riverview Dr NE (47.3206, -122.2097). Popular spot with fishermen and campers.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank.

properties.SiteSafety: SHERIFF ESCORT REQUIRED. Violent crimes in area. Impassable log jam downstream 0.5 mi. Slips, trips, falls. Woody debris in channel.

properties.SiteSafety: Beehives in area. Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank.
properties.FieldDescr: Road owned by Mosby Farm but WDFW keeps seasonal screw trap on site. Hand-launch from bank. Large sandbar across on river right often has central channel. Adjust boom and anchors as needed.
properties.Watercou_1: Low flow July - Sept. Sandbar and channel braiding will change with water level and time.
properties.StagingDes: Small dirt/grass area at end of dirt road. WDFW fish counting station/boat stored onsite.
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources, Salmon Habitat, Waterfowl Concentrations, Wetlands

properties.SiteSafety: Car traffic between parking and launch. Popular boat launch. Very shallow in low water. Pilings on river left. Slips, trips, falls. Vegetation and blackberry brambles on bank.
properties.FieldDescr: Collection is only feasible if water is above average. Large cobbles bankside in low water. Pilings on river left may be hidden in high water.
properties.StagingDes: Stage in parking lot on NW side of road; use boat launch across street

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls.  Use caution near heavily vegetated shoreline and beware of possible submerged hazards.

properties.SiteSafety: Water is shallow and sand bars at the mouth of the channel move frequently.

properties.StagingDes: Stage at SA-LCR-109.4L, M. James Gleason Memorial Boat Ramp. Launch from same BL-LCR-109.4L.

properties.SiteSafety: Water hazards, slips, trips, falls.

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil moving downstream away from the north shore of the Columbia River at this location.

properties.StagingDes: Stage at Chinook Landing Marine Park, SA-LCR-118.5L. Stage at same BL-LCR-118.5L.

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect and recover oil to prevent it from travelling downstream.

properties.SiteSafety: Water hazards, slips, trips, falls.
properties.FieldDescr: Site is west of private residence.  Make contact with neighbors before deploying strategy.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at SA-LCR-118.5L, Chinook Landing Marine Park. Launch from same BL-LCR-118.5L.
properties.Resources: Downstream Habitat, Sensitive Resources Nearby

properties.SiteSafety: Water hazards, slips, trips, falls.
properties.FieldDescr: Boat access from the Port of Camas. Vehicle access from Highway 14, contact Georgia Pacific Camas mill at 360-834-3021. At low flow, it is possible to boom off Camas Slough to prevent transfer of oil in or out of the slough.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at SA-LCR-118.5L, Chinook Landing Marine Park. Launch from same BL-LCR-118.5L.
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources, Walleye Spawning Area

properties.ObjectiveD: Prevent oil from moving up or down stream. Collect oil on north shore.
properties.Implementa: Crew 2 launch workboat from From BL-LCR-118.5L. From paper mill property, Crew 1 pass lines attached to boom to Crew 2 and deploy BM-1 at a SE angle across the slough.  Deploy BM-2 across the slough to the SW. Anchor at AP-1 using shoreside anchor posts.

properties.FieldDescr: Boat access from the Port of Camas.  Vehicle access from Highway 14, contact the Georgia Pacific Camas mill at 360-834-3021 for access.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at SA-LCR-118.5L, Chinook Landing Marine Park. Launch from same BL-LCR-118.5L.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls. Vehicle traffic and potential for shallow water hazards.
properties.FieldDescr: Main current and channel run along the Lady Island shoreline. Water to the NE of the small island is very shallow.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at Port of Camas, SA-LCR-121.6R
properties.Resources: Downstream Resources, Salmonid Concentrations and Habitat, Walleye Spawning Area

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls. Water hazards. Steep, rocky shorelines.  Pilings to S of Chinook Pt.

properties.SiteSafety: Heavy recreational boat traffic in/out of slough. Shallow water and pillings may pose a hazard.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls. Steep, eroded shoreline and riprap under bridge. Current is swift. Snags and submerged debris present.

properties.Implementa: Anchor 100-ft section of boom near A (47.2211, -122.0322). Throw heaving line across stream and extend boom NW across creek to anchor downstream near B (47.2212, -122.0325). Create collection pocket by angling boom a few feet upstream to C. Adjust anchor
properties.SiteSafety: Road traffic; overgrown vegetation; slips, trips, falls; livestock

properties.SiteSafety: Road hazard; slips, trips, falls; overgrown vegetation

properties.Implementa: Deploy boom at an angle to tide flow to collect oil on the south bank.  Use anchors and lines as needed to maintain an effective angle.  There is a dirt road along the south bank that should be vac truck accessible.
properties.SiteSafety: Several legal boundaries for fishing locations (do not remove) with fishing nets and lines that present navigational/safety hazards.  Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can be safety concerns.
properties.FieldDescr: No access to north shore.  Boat ramp upstream of tribal center.  Must have tribal guide.
properties.Watercou_1: River with tidal influence, Field Visit Width ~ 450ft
properties.StagingDes: Staging Area Quinault Nation, OC-Quinault-staging
properties.Resources: Marine Birds, Salmonids (anadromous), Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.ObjectiveD: use natural collection area in Grenville Bay - offshore skimming or onshore collection as needed.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom at an angle to use the natural eddy to help concentrate oil for skimming.  Must have tribal guide.  Will require multiple anchors.
properties.SiteSafety: Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area.
properties.FieldDescr: Single-lane, gated road to Loran Station (but 100' down to beach). Tribal guide required.  Do not drive on beach with out Tribal guide.
properties.StagingDes: Moclips River Upstream, OC-37-staging
properties.Resources: General Fish and Wildlife Resources, Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of Wreck Creek.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom across creek at bridge on Highway 109 as weather permits.  Creek width varies from 10' (spring) to 40' (winter).  In winter allow creek to flush.  Recommend lining contractor boom with sorbent boom.  Deploy on upstream side of river, in a che
properties.SiteSafety: Traffic danger - take precautions
properties.FieldDescr: Directly off Hwy 109/parking area. Beach vehicle access on both sides of Wreck Creek, about 1.25 miles to north and 0.5 miles to south.  No boat landing site.  Tribal guide required.
properties.StagingDes: Moclips River Upstream, OC-37-staging
properties.Resources: Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shorebirds, Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of river, and collection if possible.
properties.Implementa: Deploy from end of 6th street.  Anchor boom to pilings on west side of river, use skiff to anchor other end downstream on the east side of river.
properties.StagingDes: Moclips River Upstream, OC-37-staging
properties.Resources: Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shorebirds, Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of creek and collection of oil if possible.
properties.Implementa: Angle boom from bank at SE corner of bridge to the private boat ramp next to the house about 300 ft downstream on the far shore.
properties.SiteSafety: High traffic area - also trail down to water from bridge has several open holes
properties.StagingDes: Moclips River Upstream, OC-37-staging
properties.Resources: Public Lands/Facilities, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shorebirds

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of Boone Creek, and if possible collection with vac truck.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom across the entrance to the cove at the creek mouth as the weather permits. Recommend - that boom be anchored at north shore of resort road which leads to beach.   Run boom across mouth of creek in SE direction and anchor on far shore at an an
properties.SiteSafety: Use traffic precautions.
properties.FieldDescr: Road by Iron Springs Resort off 109 approx. 3 miles north of Copalis Beach
properties.StagingDes: Moclips River Upstream, OC-37-staging

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of marsh along bank, and in the main channel for collection further upstream.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom along the west side of the river  so that tides do not force oil into the marsh along the bank.
properties.SiteSafety: High traffic area, take appropriate precautions. Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area. Tribal guide required.
properties.FieldDescr: SR 112 to Neah Bay to just before Makah Tribal office complex, left across bridge, to site about 1/2 mi. past Bahobohosh Point curve.  Access to west side of river on private road.
properties.Watercou_1: large river with strong flow most of the year mud, gravel, rock

properties.Geographic: Copalis River E bank closest mouth
properties.ObjectiveD: use tide to deflect oil to collection site on west bank of Copalis River
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom from the east bank at an angle to the tidal push.  Use anchors and lines as needed to maintain an effective angle.
properties.SiteSafety: Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area.  Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.
properties.FieldDescr: Copalis Beach food Bank Parking lot has boat ramp, 24 hr lighting  & boat dock for recovery operations. Need State Park permission to drive on beach.
properties.StagingDes: Copalis River, collection site at boat launch, OC-48-staging

properties.ObjectiveD: use tidal push to collect oil on west bank
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom from the west bank at an angle to the tidal push.  Use anchors and lines as needed to maintain an effective angle.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area.
properties.FieldDescr: Under some conditions this area is vac truck accessible.  Must have permission from the park to drive along beach.
properties.Watercou_1: tides can go up about 1 mile from mouth
properties.StagingDes: Copalis River, collection site at boat launch, OC-48-staging

properties.Implementa: Deploy boom from the east bank at an angle to the tidal push.  Use anchors and lines as needed to maintain an effective angle.  Contact park regarding access to beach and possible (however unlikely) vac truck access.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.
properties.FieldDescr: Marsh habitat is extensive on both banks and includes many side channels and area should be considered of high biological value.  Additionally, west bank area is part of Griffiths/Priday State Park.
properties.Watercou_1: Marsh habitat is extensive on both banks sand, mud, logs
properties.StagingDes: Copalis River, collection site at boat launch, OC-48-staging
properties.Resources: Public Lands/Facilities, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat

properties.ObjectiveD: collect oil along west bank, before it goes upstream into marshes.
properties.Implementa: Anchor boom on west bank oriented at NE angle toward northeast bank.  Deploy boom from the west bank at an angle to the tidal push.  Use anchors and lines as needed to maintain an effective angle.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.
properties.FieldDescr: Recommend jet boat.
properties.Watercou_1: Marsh habitat is extensive on both banks and includes many side channels sand, mud, logs

properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat. Tides and storm surge can make this area very dangerous.
properties.FieldDescr: Marsh habitat is extensive on both banks and includes many side channels.

properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows. Take fast water precautions depending on flow.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.

Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area.  
Poor footing can lead to slips and trips. Tribal guide required.

properties.FieldDescr: Mouth has not changed in recent past.  Helo transport dependent on fog and low tide to land equipment and personnel.  No roads and very strenuous walk which is tide dependent.

properties.SiteSafety: This strategy is 100% helo dependent. Helo transport dependent on fog and low tide to land equipment and personnel.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, trips, and falls.  Marshy area with heavy vegetation. Highway crossing.

properties.SiteSafety: Sneaker waves, high tides, and beach logs can all be safety concerns for this area.

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of creek mouth.

properties.SiteSafety: Caution - very steep grade under HWY 112 bridge.  Thick brush, ruts, and mud can make road impassable.  At high flow do not deploy strategies.
properties.FieldDescr: Vehicle access from Highway 112, Mile Post 14.8.  Take the Sekiu exit and drive back to the creek through the treatment plant lot.  Near by street address 15053 HWY 112.
properties.Watercou_1: highly variable flow gravel, sand, rock

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of the river.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom as necessary to keep oil out of the river mouth and the channel behind the sand spit.  The position of the river mouth is variable and can be anywhere along the sand spit.  On the date of the visit - the best site was down stream from side ch
properties.SiteSafety: At high flow do not deploy strategies.  High traffic area, take appropriate precautions.
properties.FieldDescr: Boat access from Sekiu.  Vehicle access from Highway 112, Mile Post 16.7.  Callam County Park - has parking and rest rooms.
properties.Watercou_1: mouth moves seasonally, mud, sand, gravel
properties.Resources: Public Lands/Facilities, Salmonids (anadromous)

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of creek and wetlands fed by creek.
properties.Implementa: Deploy exclusion boom across creek mouth, angle so that boom is not perpendicular to the push of the tide.  Exclusion boom can be supplemented with sorbent boom.   If oil is present, deploy snare-boom along beach.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.  No need to go to Crescent Beach to get to Pysht.
properties.FieldDescr: The nearby Clallam park boat launch is only useful at high tides.  Might be better to contact Merril and Ring to get direct road access to river bank.
properties.Watercou_1: feed into nearby wetlands, mouth may meander mud
properties.Resources: Forage Fish, Raptors, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shellfish, Shorebirds, Waterfowl

properties.Geographic: Pysht River W bank side channel
properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of side channel and in main channel for collection upstream
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom parallel to the main channel on the west bank.  Position boom so that opening to side channel is blocked off.  Will need boat to get to west bank.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.
properties.FieldDescr: Dynamic river, with extremely variable flow.  The nearby park boat launch is only useful at high tides.  Might be better to contact Merril and Ring to get direct road access to river bank.
properties.Watercou_1: channel feeds marsh area, tidal flush mud
properties.Resources: Forage Fish, Raptors, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shellfish, Shorebirds, Waterfowl

properties.Geographic: Pysht River W bank near mouth
properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil in the main channel for collection upstream
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom parallel to the main channel on the west bank.  Will need boat to get to the west bank.  At low tide most of area is mud - bring waders.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.
properties.FieldDescr: The nearby Pillar Point County Park ramp boat launch useful only at high tides.  Might be better to contact Merril and Ring to get direct road access.
properties.Watercou_1: marsh along banks are perched, but high tides and channel feed them
properties.Resources: Forage Fish, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shellfish, Shorebirds, Waterfowl

properties.Geographic: Pysht River E bank near mouth
properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil in the main river channel for collection up stream and keep oil out of tidal pond to the east.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom parallel to the main channel on the east bank to block off opening of pond and keep oil in main channel.  Sticky mud bring waders.
properties.SiteSafety: Beware of submerged logs and shallows.  Recommend jet boat.  Area can have high mosquito concentrations.
properties.FieldDescr: The nearby Pillar Point County Park ramp boat launch is useful only at high tides.  Might be better to contact Merril and Ring to get direct road access.
properties.Resources: Forage Fish, Raptors, Salmonids (anadromous), Sensitive Habitat, Shellfish, Shorebirds, Waterfowl

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil out of the creek mouth.
properties.Implementa: The creek discharges through a culvert, and the stream flow will prevent oil from entering the culvert most of the year.  If the stream flow is low, deploy boom to keep oil from entering the culvert at high tide. If oil is present, deploy snare-boom alon
properties.SiteSafety: At high flow do not deploy strategies.  Poor footing can lead to slips, trips and falls.
properties.FieldDescr: The creek mouth is at the east end of the lower parking lot in the Pillar Point County Park.  Vehicle access from Highway 112 at Mile Post 29.8.
properties.Watercou_1: discharges through culvert, only at risk low flow and high tide
properties.Resources: Public Lands/Facilities, Salmonids (anadromous)

properties.ObjectiveD: keep oil of creek.
properties.Implementa: Deploy boom across the mouth at an angle to tidal push.  If oil is present, deploy snare-boom along beach.  The actual location will be dependent on real time conditions, adjust as needed.
properties.SiteSafety: At high flow do not deploy strategies.
properties.FieldDescr: Road access by private road with locked gate.  If unable to get road access -  launch  boat at Pillar Point Rec. area boat launch.  Need chest waders to launch work boat.
properties.Watercou_1: samll creek in private camp ground, discharges through culvert rock, sand, gravel
properties.StagingDes: Campground onsite

properties.ObjectiveD: Prevent oil from impacting fish pens on Youngs River.

properties.StagingDes: Stage onsite from Wireless Road.

properties.SiteSafety: US Navy Property; Road Traffic; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Vegetation

properties.StagingDes: US Navy property, advance notice and escort required. Stage at road shoulder nearby.

properties.SiteSafety: Rip Rap; Shallow Tideflats; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Very shallow, deploy at high tide only. Port Orchard pocket park, Port of Bremerton owns marina.

properties.SiteSafety: Roadway Hazard; Steep Banks; Rip Rap; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard;
properties.FieldDescr: LANE CLOSURE REQUIRED. Follow WSDOT guidelines for flaggers. Gravel shoulder at Sacco Ln or 500ft south on Beach Dr. Shallow boat access only at high tide.
properties.StagingDes: LANE CLOSURE REQUIRED. Stage equipment along roadside.
properties.Resources: Estuary Resources, Salmonids, Salt Marsh, Waterfowl Concentrations, Wetlands

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of Blakely Harbor tidal estuary
properties.Implementa: Secure end of 100ft length of boom to shore at northeast side of entrance to marsh, at edge of rip-rap, at A.  Extend boom SW across marsh entrance and secure other end to shore at C. If water depth allows, extend midpoint of boom into Blakely Harbor to
properties.SiteSafety: Rip-Rap; Exposed Rebar; Abandoned Building; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: Ship Traffic; Drawbridge; Rip Rap; Electricity Towers; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Roadway Hazard

properties.Resources: Habitat Mitigation Site/Project, Salmonids, Salt Marsh, T/E Species, Waterfowl

properties.Geographic: Wapato Creek at Alexander Ave (Blair Waterway)
properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil from Wapato Creek
properties.Implementa: Secure 100ft of boom to shore at roadside, at B. Extend boom across creek and secure to western bank at A. Back with sorbent. Collect from parking area by B. If spill is coming from the north, reverse boom angle by moving B south, and add extra sorbent b
properties.SiteSafety: Roadway Hazard; Steep Banks; Overhead Lines; Vegetation; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Tidal creek connects to Blair Waterway. Steep banks with blackberry. Gravel shoulder parking next to site.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at gravel shoulder onsite, east of Alexander Ave.

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of salt marsh

properties.SiteSafety: Shallow Tideflats; Driftwood; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Difficult boat access at low tide, may be easier to land nearby and walk down the beach. Narrow inlet with sand/gravel beaches, easy slope.
properties.StagingDes: Stage and launch from Bainbridge City Dock
properties.Resources: Estuary Resources, Salmonids, Salt Marsh

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of Shingle Mill Creek
properties.Implementa: Secure one end of 100ft length of boom to shore on creek right, at A. Then extend boom SW across mouth of stream and secure at B. Back with sorbent. Use additional anchoring systems as needed to keep boom secure in water.
properties.SiteSafety: Shallow Estuary; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Public Park
properties.FieldDescr: Notify Vashon Park District prior to arrival; call 206-463-9602 and ask them to notify any guests at the house. Advise you will cut lock on entry gate. Slight incline down beach from yard, may need waders or shallow boat at high tide.
properties.Watercou_1: Shingle Mill Creek at Fern Cove
properties.StagingDes: Stage equipment by historic rental house.
properties.Resources: City Park, Estuary Resources, Salmonids, Salt Marsh

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of Blair Waterway or Erdahl Ditch
properties.Implementa: Using workboat, secure 500ft of boom to sandy shore, at A. Extend boom north and east, across culvert entrance, and secure to pilings at shore under dock, at C. Pull boom midpoint into Blair Waterway and set anchor at B to create chevron. Tie sorbent acr
properties.SiteSafety: Overhead Cranes; Pilings with Low Overhead; Commercial Ship Traffic; Extreme Tide Change; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Pump station onsite controls ditch flow, managed by City of Fife - call first and request shutdown. Culvert hidden at high tide. At high tide, anchor temporarily to outermost piling, then pull boom further into pilings when overhead clearance allows.
properties.StagingDes: Stage and launch from Point Defiance. Some staging at Port, but it's a steep drop at low tide.
properties.Resources: Salmonids, T/E Species

properties.Geographic: Westside of Puget Sound Naval Shipyard
properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil from Puget Sound
properties.Implementa: Secure 800ft of boom to shore near rip-rap, at A. Using workboat, extend boom SE at an angle towards carriers, and anchor remaining end of boom in-water.  Use additional anchors, adjust boom angle, or move anchor points as needed for conditions. Collect
properties.SiteSafety: Railroad Crossing; Road Traffic; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Slippery Banks
properties.FieldDescr: CAUTION: unmarked railroad crossing. Notify Puget Sound Naval Shipyard before arriving; call 360-476-7111.
properties.StagingDes: Stage equipment onsite or at Port Orchard Marina
properties.Resources: Eelgrass, Shorebird Concentrations, Waterfowl

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of Little Marsh habitat mitigation site

properties.SiteSafety: Petroleum Loading Dock; Rip-Rap; Unstable Shoreline; Active Port; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Alert US Oil before approaching dock. Also call City of Tacoma 253-591-5000, Environmental Services manages site. Restoration site with soft banks, next to US Oil dock with pilings/fence poles.
properties.StagingDes: Stage and launch from Point Defiance
properties.Resources: Habitat Mitigation Site/Project, Salt Marsh

properties.ObjectiveD: Keep oil out of marina at State Park
properties.Implementa: Using workboat, secure 600 ft of boom to shore at beach, at A. Extend across opening of marina and secure other end to rip-rap, at E. Use piling bridles on dolphin nearest shore and pilings 5 and 6 to hold boom in place. Adjust as needed for conditions.
properties.SiteSafety: Vessel Traffic; Rip-Rap; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Argosy Cruises runs tours in summer, alert if marina will be closed off. Several pilings across entrance and nearshore to hold boom weight. Restrooms on site at Tillicum Village.
properties.StagingDes: No road access. Stage and launch from Seattle area.
properties.Resources: Economic Resource, Marina, State Park, Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.ObjectiveD: Collect oil from Commencement Bay or Blair Waterway
properties.Implementa: Using workboat, secure 700ft of boom to shore near barge launch, at A. Extend SW into Blair Waterway and anchor mid-channel, at B. Adjust number of anchors, anchor points, and boom angle as needed for conditions. Collect from shore at A. For spills from
properties.SiteSafety: Industrial Equipment; Road Traffic; Ship Traffic; Active Port; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Extreme tide changes. Rip-rap banks. Truck and equipment storage near industrial barge launch area.
properties.StagingDes: Stage onsite in parking/storage area. Launch onsite with permission, or from Point Defiance.
properties.Resources: Economic Resource, Habitat Mitigation Site/Project, Salmonids, Waterfowl, Wetlands

properties.Implementa: Using workboat, secure 500ft of boom to N shore, at A. Extend boom S to end of metal bulkhead and secure to shore at treeline, at B. If conditions require, set anchor at midpoint to hold boom in place. Adjust anchor points as needed.

properties.FieldDescr: Gravel cove between Husky Terminal and Concrete Technology Corp.

properties.SiteSafety: Tall Pier; Vehicle Hazard; Fishing; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: Rip-Rap; Submerged Habitat; Port Traffic; Roadway Hazard; Railway Hazard; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: Low Bridge; Road Hazard; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Kayakers; Fishing
properties.FieldDescr: Low bridge (~5ft at high tide). Extreme shallow and narrow channel except at highest tide. Use bridge, waders, or kayak to get line across channel.

properties.SiteSafety: Houseboats; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.StagingDes: Stage and launch from Sunnyside Ave N boat launch; small parks onsite

properties.SiteSafety: Rip Rap; Shallow Tideflats; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Vegetation

properties.SiteSafety: Commercial Ship Traffic; Fishing; Unstable Banks; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Tidal influence. Ships/barges may be docked at cement plant (was Ideal, now LaFarge). Tribal fishing nets may also be in area. Usual anchor points may need to be adjusted.

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: If possible use buoys and pilings to secure boom. Minimize prop scour and rope cutting of eelgrass bed. Beach anchoring on private property/vacation homes. Work with Suquamish Tribe before deploying.

properties.SiteSafety: Shellfish Beds and Buoys; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Easiest at high tide. Shallow stream delta with seasonal shellfish beds. Priority is to protect upper beach.
properties.StagingDes: Stage at Suquamish Boat Ramp. Land access and parking on-site at Suquamish Seafoods/Chief Kitsap High School..
properties.Resources: Forage Fish, Sensitive Resources, Shellfish, Tribal Lands/Resources

properties.Watercou_1: Point Monroe Lagoon at Port Madison

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
properties.FieldDescr: Shallow water with small entrance to tidal estuary at Kiana Lodge (Suquamish Tribe) property.

properties.SiteSafety: Active Railroad; Shallow Tideflats; Public Beach; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: SCUBA Park; Sandbars; Rip-Rap; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Public Park

properties.SiteSafety: Submerged Pilings; Unstable Banks; Overhead Power Lines; Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard; Steep Banks

properties.SiteSafety: Slips, Trips, Falls; Water Hazard
